page.title: 01Life in rural community
page.content: The "D" Block is situated in the South East corner of Cheshire.The land is fairly flat and approximately 200ft above sea level.Both Basford Brook and Englessea Brook flow in a northernly direction and are situated in the west and the East of the "D"block respectively.The rain falls between 24 inches and 40 inches per annum.In the "D"block there is mainly Dairy farming and the woodland is mainly mixed.The temperature in the "D"block is between 8 centigrade and 30 centigrade.In the Weston area the major roads are the 5020 and the A52. The railway runs east to west in the northern section of the "D"block.The Industry is the Pharmaceutical Manufactures and the Tea Processing Factory.Also there are three cottage industries they are a sports goods firm and a timber merchants.
